main.name: Ben Anderson
main.description: Here will be your description. Use this to describe what you do or whatever you feel best describes yourself to a potential employer
main.bio: I am a young, aspiring Web Developer, as well as a space enthusiast.  I began a coding bootcamp, DevMountain, in September of 2019 without any prior coding experience. Rather quickly, I discovered that coding was something I thoroughly enjoyed. Since I started at the bootcamp, my overall knowledge of coding has grown exponentially every single day.
main.contactmessage: Contact me for any business inquiries, a phone call is the best way to get in touch.

education.description: DevMountain is a 13-week, immersive Web Development bootcamp. In that time, I built two full-stack and one 3/4-stack web applications.

work.title: Group Project ~ December 2019
work.description: A full-stack web app built as a teaching tool, similar to Stack Overflow, for DevMountain to implement into their curriculum. Only DM students and staff are able to register on the site. Students can post questions to a forum where classmates, staff and alumni can answer the questions. I wrote the vast majority of the backend and most of the front-end functionality. Technologies Used: React.js, Node.js, CSS, HTML, SQL, Firebase, GreenSock, React Quill, React Markdown, Nodemailer, React Modal

work.title: Personal Project ~ November 2019
work.description: A full-stack web app for all things movies and TV, inspired by IMDb. A user can create an account, search for movies, TV shows and actors, add their favorite movies / TV shows to a personal watchlist. They can also find movie times and purchase movie tickets from Fandago. Technologies Used: React.js, Express-Session, JavaScript, Node.js, SASS, HTML, Firebase and Restful API's

work.title: NoDb Project ~ October 2019
work.description: A 3/4-stack web app that allows the user to create their own FIFA card and build an ultimate team. Technologies Used: React.js, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, Node.js and Express.

projects.title: BMDb
projects.category: A Movie and TV Show Database

projects.title: BUT Head
projects.category: FIFA Card and Ultimate Team Creator

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
